{"step_by_step_thinking": "Comprehensive emergency obstetric care includes all interventions necessary to address complications that may arise during pregnancy, childbirth, and the postpartum period. This includes manual removal of placenta, which is often necessary in cases of retained placenta; blood transfusion, which is crucial in managing severe bleeding; and cesarean section, which is a life-saving surgical procedure when vaginal delivery is not possible or safe. However, hysterectomy, which is the surgical removal of the uterus, is not typically included in the package of comprehensive emergency obstetric care services. It is a last resort procedure typically performed when all other measures to control bleeding have failed and the woman's life is at risk.", "answer_choice": "B"}
